intro: Leucanthemum auriculatum, commonly known as the golden marguerite, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow at the center and white at the edges, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
